dialogue: Wallababy, I don't want you riding in that playboy's car.
Funny, I thought playboys were the type that drank whiskey and smoked cigars all day.
No, sweetie. That's who pays for your matinées. What did you "not see"?
You're going to give your mother a heart attack if you keep on disappearing like that.
Not my fault if the city's crawling with pigs harassing everyone.
Look, while this ambassador thing's still going on, I don't want you going out at night.
What are you going to do, Mr. Congressman? Lock me up at home?
... a photo of me crossing Abbey Road, just to make you jealous.
We're just heading out to the lagoon--
-This is your going-away party, Vera. C'mon.
Hey! Isn't this my party? I get to pick the music.
What happened to peace and love, Vera? You'll get tired of this gringo music.
Might I have the honor of a dance with this young lady?
Will you put me on your dance card?
